page.title: 03CLIMATE
page.content: The climate in this part of the world plays a very important part in the life of the community and the main industry of the area, hill farming. Being at the summit of the Northern Pennines, and the Dale being exposed to the prevailing South Westerly winds, the average annual rainfall is one of the highest in the country. This is an aid to the main crop production, namely grass. The hill formation causes very localised weather patterns. During most winters, the Dales are subject to a moderate snowfall, but they seldom suffer the extremes experienced in other parts of the Pennines. After a sudden thaw or heavy rain, the low meadows and valley roads are often flooded.
